intro: Silene melanopotamica subsp. nivosimontana, commonly known as the snow-montane silene, is a flowering plant species native to high-altitude regions of the Eastern Cape in South Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats, often in areas with cool, moist conditions. Its subspecific name, *nivosimontana*, refers to its occurrence in snow-covered mountainous environments. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
